revisions.rev:
{{Infobox_Radio_station | name = Radyo ng Bayan Iloilo | image = | city = [[Iloilo City]] | area = [[Iloilo]] | branding = Radyo ng Bayan (National Radio) | slogan = Tagapag-ugnay ng Pamahalaan at ng Mamamayan (Converging Government and Citizens) | airdate = 1965 | frequency = 585 kHz | format = [[music]], [[news]], [[Public affairs programming|public affairs]], [[government shows]], [[entertainment]] | power = 1,000 [[watt]]s | erp = 2,000 [[watt]]s | class = B | callsign_meaning = '''DY'''
I'''L'''oi'''L'''o | former_callsigns = DYCI (1965-1989) | owner = [[Philippine Broadcasting Service]] | website = [http://www.pbs.gov.ph PBS] }} '''Radyo ng Bayan Iloilo''' (DYLL 585 kHz [[Iloilo City]]) is an [[AM broadcasting|AM]] station owned and operated by [[Philippine Broadcasting Service]] in the [[Philippines]]. DYLL [[studio]] is located at PRC Bldg, Bonifacio Drive, [[Iloilo City]]. While there AM transmitter is located at Molo, Iloilo City. == Radyo ng Bayan Iloilo History == * First broadcast as '''DYCI 585 kHz''' in 1965. * In 1989, change to '''DYLL 594''' but after few months on 594 kHz they move back to 585 kHz. == See also == *[[DZRB-AM|DZRB Radyo ng Bayan 738]] {{Iloilo City AM}} {{coord missing|Philippines}} [[Category:Iloilo City radio stations]] [[Category:News and talk radio stations in the Philippines]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 1965]] [[Category:National Broadcasting Network]] {{Philippines-radio-station-stub}}
